maze_solve.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 """ Package that solves the maze
2 
3 Input
4  maze - An array of the maze map with the walls and free space points assigned a certain value
5  start - The index of the start point
6  end - The index of the end point
7 
8 Output
9  x_list - list of first indices of the calculated trajectory
10  y_list - list of second indices of the calculated trajectory
11 """
12 
13 from re import X
14 import numpy as np
15 import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
16 
17 class Solver():
18 
19  def __init__(self, maze):
20  """
21  Init function
22 
23  INPUTS:
24  maze (np.array) ~ mask containing walls of the maze as nonzero
25  OUTPUTS:
26  none
27  """
28  self.maze = maze
29  self.wall_cost_function = np.zeros(np.shape(maze))
30  self.goal_cost_function = np.zeros(np.shape(maze))-1
31  self.x_list = []
32  self.y_list = []
33  self.neighbors = [
34  (-1, -1),
35  (-1, 0),
36  (-1, 1),
37  (0, -1),
38  (0, 1),
39  (1, -1),
40  (1, 0),
41  (1, 1)
42  ]
43 
44 
45  def goal_cost(self, goal):
46  """
47  Iterates over map to generate path cost map instance variable
48 
49  INPUTS:
50  goal (np.array) ~ goal cell
51  OUTPUTS:
52  none
53  """
54 
55  queue = [(goal[0], goal[1])]
56  self.goal_cost_function[goal[1]][goal[0]] = 0
57  n = 0
58  while len(queue) > 0:
59  n = n+1
60  index = queue.pop(0)
61  goal_cost = self.goal_cost_function[index[1]][index[0]]
62  for shift in self.neighbors:
63  xs = index[0] + shift[0]
64  ys = index[1] + shift[1]
65  try:
66  if self.goal_cost_function[ys][xs] == -1 and self.maze[ys][xs] == 0:
67  self.goal_cost_function[ys][xs] = goal_cost + 1 + self.wall_cost_function[ys][xs]
68  queue.append((xs, ys))
69 
70  except:
71  pass
72  print(n)
73 
74  def wall_cost(self):
75  """
76  Iterates over map to generate wall cost map instance variable
77 
78  INPUTS:
79  none
80  OUTPUTS:
81  none
82  """
83  (y, x) = np.where(self.maze>0)
84  walls = [(x[i],y[i]) for i in range(len(y))]
85  queue = walls.copy()
86  n=0
87  while len(queue) > 0:
88  index = queue.pop(0)
89  cost = self.wall_cost_function[index[1]][index[0]]
90  for shift in self.neighbors:
91  xs = index[0] + shift[0]
92  ys = index[1] + shift[1]
93 
94  if xs < 0 or ys < 0:
95  continue
96  try:
97  if self.maze[ys][xs] == 0 and self.wall_cost_function[ys][xs] == 0:
98  self.wall_cost_function[ys][xs] = cost + 1
99  queue.append((xs, ys))
100  print(cost-0.5)
101 
102  except Exception as e:
103  pass
104  self.wall_cost_function = (np.max(self.wall_cost_function) - self.wall_cost_function)**2
105 
106 
107  def descend(self, cur):
108  """
109  Iterates over cost map to generate path
110 
111  INPUTS:
112  cur (np.array) ~ start cell
113  OUTPUTS:
114  none
115  """
116  queue = [cur]
117  while True:
118  index = queue.pop(0)
119  if self.maze[index[1]][index[0]] == 0:
120  cur = (index[0], index[1])
121  break
122  else:
123  for shift in self.neighbors:
124  queue.append((index[0]+shift[0], index[1]+shift[1]))
125  x = cur[0]
126  y = cur[1]
127  print(x)
128  print(y)
129  cost = self.goal_cost_function[y][x]
130 
131  while not self.goal_cost_function[y][x] == 0:
132  print(x, y)
133  lastx=x
134  lasty=y
135  self.x_list.append(x)
136  self.y_list.append(y)
137  n_x = x
138  n_y = y
139  for shift in self.neighbors:
140  if y+shift[1]<0 or x+shift[0]<0:
141  continue
142  try:
143  n_cost = self.goal_cost_function[y+shift[1]][x+shift[0]]
144  if n_cost < cost and n_cost > 0:
145  cost = n_cost
146  n_x = x+shift[0]
147  n_y = y+shift[1]
148  except:
149  pass
150  x = n_x
151  y = n_y
152  if lastx == x and lasty == y:
153  break
154 
155  self.x_list.append(x)
156  self.y_list.append(y)
157  self.path = np.zeros(np.shape(self.maze))
158  for i in range(len(self.x_list)):
159  self.path[self.y_list[i]][self.x_list[i]] = 255
160 
161  def solve_maze(self, start, end):
162  """
163  Solves a maze
164 
165  INPUTS:
166  start (np.array) ~ start cell
167  end (np.array) ~ end cell
168  OUTPUTS:
169  none
170  """
171  self.wall_cost()
172  print("Wall done!")
173  self.goal_cost(end)
174  print(self.maze)
175  print(self.goal_cost_function)
176  self.descend(start)
177  return (self.x_list, self.y_list)
178 
179  def solve_follow(self, start, end):
180  """
181  Follows a line by maze solving an inverted maze.
182 
183  INPUTS:
184  start (np.array) ~ start cell
185  end (np.array) ~ end cell
186  OUTPUTS:
187  none
188  """
189  maze_temp = self.maze
190  inv_maze = np.zeros(np.shape(self.maze))
191  inv_maze = np.where(self.maze == -1, 0, inv_maze)
192  inv_maze = np.where(self.maze == 0, -1, inv_maze)
193  self.maze = inv_maze
194  response = self.solve_maze(start, end)
195  self.maze = maze_temp
196  return response
